_header: By deeds of Dyane I swear to thee
Subjects: marriage, oath for; sermons, verse in; oaths; translations
_description: A wedding oath, a tag in the Fasciculus morum — one couplet translating ‘Iuro tibi sane per mistica sacra Dyane / Me tibi nupturam sponsam comitemque futuram’, which precedes it

Bod410.Transcription:
By dedys of dyane I swere to þeHer after to take & wedde
                    þe

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
By dedes of dyane I swere to þeHere after to take & wedde
                    þe

BodLauMis111.Transcription:
Be dedys of dyane I swere to theHere after to taken and wedden
                    the

BodRawC670.Transcription:
By dedes of [dyane] I swere to theHer aftur to take and wedde
                    the
BodRawC670.Editions:
Silverstein,  Theodore,
                        ed.  
             Medieval English Lyrics.
         York Medieval Texts. London: Edw. Arnold, 1971: 97.

CamGon71.Transcription:
By þe ath þat I swere to þehere after to take &
                    wedd þe

CamGon364.Transcription:
Be dedys of diane I swere to þehere after to taken & wedde
                    þe

DULCosViv2.Transcription:
By dedys of dyane I swere to þeHer after to take and to wedde
                    the

EDU82.Transcription:
By dedes of dyane I swere to thehere after to take and wedde
                    the

Lincoln44.Transcription:
By dedys of dyan y swere to þehere aftir to take and wedde
                    þe

Spalding.Transcription:
Be bedes of diane I swere to thehere after to take and wed
                    þe

WorcF19.Transcription:
By þe othe þat y swere þo to þehere
                    after to take & wedde me
